doc.title: GitHub cheatsheet
doc.sidebarHTML:
1. About MDN
  2. Contributing to MDN
    1. Get started on MDN
    2. Contributing to MDN
    3. Things you can do
    4. Localizing MDN
    5. Guidelines
    6. Content structures

value.content: This article provides a quick reference to the essential commands you'll need when using Git and GitHub to contribute to MDN. If you are new to these tools and need a helping hand, our GitHub for complete beginners tutorial teaches the basics.

value.title: Cloning
value.content: git clone the-repo-url

value.title: Setting up a remote
value.content: git remote add remote-name repo-you-want-to-point-to

value.title: View remotes list
value.content: git remote -v

value.title: Preparing to make a change to the repo
Switch to the main branch
value.content: git switch main

value.title: Update your main branch
value.content:
git fetch remote-name
git rebase remote-name/main
git push

value.title: Get your branch locally and switch to it
value.content:
git pull
git switch new-branch

value.title: Get latest status
value.content: git status

value.title: Adding, committing, and pushing changes
value.content:
git add path-to-changed-file
git commit -m 'my commit message'
git push

value.title: Reverting a change you made to a file that you haven't yet added to the commit list
value.content: git restore file-path

value.title: Removing a file from the commit list
value.content: git restore --staged file-path

value.title: Reversing the last commit
value.content: git reset HEAD~1

value.title: Reversing a commit that has been pushed to the remote fork
value.content:
git revert HEAD
git push

Note: Another way to handle getting rid of files that have ended up in pull requests that you don't want to be there is to use the GitHub UI. Go to your pull request's page on github.com, go to the "Files changed" tab, and find the file you want to remove from the pull request. At the top right of the file's box in the page there will be a "three dot" (...) menu. Press this button and choose "Delete file". In the confirmation page, enter a title for the new commit, make sure the "Commit directly..." checkbox is selected, and press the "Commit changes" button.

value.title: Want to see more?
value.content: If you think this cheatsheet should contain more commands, please create an issue to suggest what you think we should include.

toc.text: Preparing to make a change to the repo
Get your branch locally and switch to it
